question: What is 6LoWPAN and why is there a need for 6LoWPAN?

choices.text: 6LoWPAN is IPv6 over Low-power Wireless Personal Area Networks—an adaptation layer to carry IPv6 over IEEE 802.15.4.
Need: 802.15.4 frames are tiny (127 bytes) vs. IPv6 MTU (≥1280 bytes); 6LoWPAN adds header compression and fragmentation so constrained nodes can use IPv6 efficiently.
6LoWPAN is a replacement for IPv6 on the Internet backbone.
Need: to enable IPv4 over Wi-Fi in high-throughput LANs.
6LoWPAN eliminates the need for IPv6 entirely on IoT devices.
